result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Steven Ustarbowski was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Placement (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defct)
of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

8:40 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement, upon plea to counts 3 & 4, will recommend institutional care with the Department of Health Services and the balance of the counts are to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Zamzow concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court regarding penalty.  Statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Zamzow.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 3 & 4.  Court orders judgement of NOT GUILTY by reason of mental disease or defect be entered today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Deborah Blankenburg.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court finds the defendant Not Guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on count 3 & 4.  Court sentences the defendant to the maximum sentence of 10 years and is committed to the Department of Health Services, concurrent to any other sentence.

Jail credit from 04/23/2015 to today - 253 days.

Court orders defendant to re-pay:
-Rest - 336.85
-Court costs
-attorney fees.
-DNA sample.

Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.

Court adjourned at 9:09 am.

NOTE:  Per Judge - no court costs due.
Miscellaneous Letters
Summary of Restitution - $336.85
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 08:30 am

Atty Zamzow has received the report from the Doctor.  No additional report requested by either counsel.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - is ready to proceed to plea & sentencing.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by DA - will be requesting institutional care.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on January 11, 2016 ast 8:30 a.m.

3:11 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $25,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Cecil C & Virginia U.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms and if defendant has any, they are to be turned over the Green Lake County Sheriff's Dept.  Court orders if no DNA sample was taken ath the time of arrest, defendant is to must submit to a DNA test.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
